info.title: Residential - Service Usages Broadbands (Proxy Apigee: residential-serviceusagesbroadbands-v1)
info.description:
Version Author Vendor Date Changes
1.0 Manoel Messias de Barros Junior DXC Technology 2024-12-01 [Modernizacao SOA] - Versao inicial
## Objetivo API responsavel por consulta de informacoes de consumo de franquia de banda larga de clientes Claro Residencial. ## Publico-Alvo Ate a data desta especificacao os potenciais consumidores sao: * APPNETAPP * NETSMS ## Provedores Backend:
O backend provedor da API e o microsservico consumption-netsms-serviceusagesbroadbands-v1:

GET - /consumption/v1/netsms/serviceusages/broadbands - responsavel por consulta de informacoes de consumo de franquia de banda larga de cliente Claro Residencial.
## Contexto em que a API se insere Esta API esta inserida no conjunto de APIs para a Modernizacao do SOA Legado Residencial que visa substituir o seguinte servico: * ControleFranquias12V1 - /ativar/aprovisionamento/controlefranquias/ControleFranquias12V1
(operacoes: listarConsolidado e listarDetalhado)

get.summary: Backend: ServiceUsagesBroadbands -  Realiza consulta das informacoes de consumo de franquia de banda larga de forma consolidada ou detalhada de um contrato.

parameters.name: X-Correlation-Id
parameters.description: Codigo UUID identificador da transacao fornecido pelo consumidor da API/MS.

parameters.name: X-QueryString
parameters.description:
Header query string (LGPD compliant) onde sao informados os campos de consulta de franquia de banda larga de clientes Claro Residencial. #### CENARIO 01: Consulta consolidada de informacoes de consumo de franquia utilizando customerContractId e operatorCode para identificacao do contrato.
Campos:
customerContractId: Numero do contrato*
operatorCode: Codigo identificador da operadora*
addressableCode: Codigo enderecavel do equipamento*
startDate: Data inicial do periodo de consulta*
endDate: Data final do periodo de consulta*
detailed: Flag para indicar se as informacoes devem retornar detalhas. Se False, retorna mes a mes; se True, retorna dia a dia.*
Exemplo: `customerContractId=234324308&operatorCode=052&addressableCode=D86C5A4C8C8D&startDate=2024-04-01&endDate=2024-08-01&detailed=false`
#### CENARIO 02: Consulta detalhada de informacoes de consumo de franquia utilizando customerContractId e operatorCode para identificacao do contrato.
Campos:
customerContractId: Numero do contrato*
operatorCode: Codigo identificador da operadora*
addressableCode: Codigo enderecavel do equipamento*
startDate: Data inicial do periodo de consulta*
endDate: Data final do periodo de consulta*
detailed: Flag para indicar se as informacoes devem retornar detalhadas. Se False, retorna mes a mes; se True, retorna dia a dia.*
Exemplo: `customerContractId=234324308&operatorCode=052&addressableCode=D86C5A4C8C8D&startDate=2024-07-01&endDate=2024-08-01&detailed=true`
#### CENARIO 03: Consulta consolidada de informacoes de consumo de franquia utilizando customerContractId e cityId para identificacao do contrato.
Campos:
customerContractId: Numero do contrato*
cityId: Codigo identificador da operadora*
addressableCode: Codigo enderecavel do equipamento*
startDate: Data inicial do periodo de consulta*
endDate: Data final do periodo de consulta*
detailed: Flag para indicar se as informacoes devem retornar detalhas. Se False, retorna mes a mes; se True, retorna dia a dia.*
Exemplo: `customerContractId=234324308&cityId=05509&addressableCode=D86C5A4C8C8D&startDate=2024-04-01&endDate=2024-08-01&detailed=false`
#### CENARIO 04: Consulta consolidada de informacoes de consumo de franquia utilizando smartCardNumber para identificacao do contrato e cidade.
Campos:
customerContractId: Numero do contrato para identificacao do contrato.
operatorCode: Codigo identificador da operadora.
smartCardNumber: Numero do Smart Card do equipamento.*
addressableCode: Codigo enderecavel do equipamento.*
startDate: Data inicial do periodo de consulta.*
endDate: Data final do periodo de consulta.*
detailed: Flag para indicar se as informacoes devem retornar detalhas. Se False, retorna mes a mes; se True, retorna dia a dia.*
Exemplo: `smartCardNumber=0D86C5A4C8C8D&addressableCode=D86C5A4C8C8D&startDate=2024-04-01&endDate=2024-08-01&detailed=false`


A string resultante contem campos com nome e valor separados pelo simbolo "&".

200.description: Business object representing the customer broadband usage.

allOf.description: Root structure of a consolidated broadband service usage GET response.

transactionId.description: Transaction's tracking identification generated by API.

serviceUsage.description: Business object that represents the consolidated service usage for broadband.

dataAllowance.description: Business object representing the broadband data quota in consolidated usage.

quota.description: Quota da franquia de banda larga do cliente.

creditPools.description: Business object representing the consolidated credit pools with usage details.

items.description: Business Object representing a single consolidated credit pool entry.

month.description: Mes de referencia do pool de creditos.

totalUsagePercentage.description: Percentual de utilizacao do total disponivel.

allOf.description: Root structure of a detailed broadband service usage GET response.

transactionId.description: Transaction's tracking identification generated by API.

serviceUsage.description: Business object that represents the detailed service usage for broadband.

dataAllowance.description: Business object representing the broadband data quota in detailed usage.

quota.description: Quota da franquia de banda larga do cliente.

creditPools.description: Business object representing the detailed credit pools with usage details.

items.description: Business object representing a single detailed credit pool entry.

date.description: Dia de referencia do pool de creditos.

totalUsagePercentage.description: Percentual de utilizacao do total disponivel.

error.detailedMessage: Required some parameters not found: 'customerContractId' or 'smartCardNumber'. It is mandatory to fill only one of the two fields informed.
For requests that uses 'customerContractId', it is necessary to enter the 'cityId' or 'operatorCode'. It is mandatory to fill only one of the two fields informed.
Format data field informed is no valid. Only numbers are valid. Please check the documentation out to know the correct way to fill in the fields.
Required parameters not found: 'addressableCode', 'startDate', 'endDate', or the boolean flag 'detailed'. It is mandatory to fill all of the fields informed.
The xquery string informed is out of standard. Please check the documentation out to know the correct way to fill in the fields.
The endDate field contains a date earlier than the startDate. Please enter an endDate later than the startDate.

text/html.example:
Error 401--Unauthorized

From RFC 2068 Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1:

10.4.2 401 Unauthorized

The request requires user authentication. The response MUST include a WWW-Authenticate header field...

Error 403--Forbidden

From RFC 2068 Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1:

10.4.4 403 Forbidden

The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Authorization will not help and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated. If the request method was not HEAD and the server wishes to make public why the request has not been fulfilled, it SHOULD describe the reason for the refusal in the entity. This status code is commonly used when the server does not wish to reveal exactly why the request has been refused, or when no other response is applicable.

Error 404--Not Found

From RFC 2068 Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1:

10.4.5 404 Not Found

The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.

If the server does not wish to make this information available to the client, the status code 403 (Forbidden) can be used instead. The 410 (Gone) status code SHOULD be used if the server knows, through some internally configurable mechanism, that an old resource is permanently unavailable and has no forwarding address.

  <soap:Body>
     <soap:Fault>
        <soap:Code>
           <soap:Value>soap:Receiver</soap:Value>
        </soap:Code>
        <soap:Reason>
           <soap:Text xml:lang="pt">BEA-382510: ALSB Assign action failed updating variable "errorHandlerRequest": com.bea.wli.common.xquery.XQueryException: Error parsing XML: {err}FORG0005: expected exactly one item, got 0 items</soap:Text>
        </soap:Reason>
        <soap:Detail>
           <con:fault xmlns:con="http://www.bea.com/wli/sb/context">
              <con:errorCode>BEA-382510</con:errorCode>
              <con:reason>ALSB Assign action failed updating variable "errorHandlerRequest": com.bea.wli.common.xquery.XQueryException: Error parsing XML: {err}FORG0005: expected exactly one item, got 0 items</con:reason>
              <con:location>
                 <con:path>request-pipeline</con:path>
                 <con:error-handler>true</con:error-handler>
              </con:location>
           </con:fault>
        </soap:Detail>
     </soap:Fault>
  </soap:Body>
 </soap:Envelope>

text/html.example:
Error 503--Service Unavailable

From RFC 2068 Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1:

10.5.4 503 Service Unavailable

The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server. The implication is that this is a temporary condition which will be alleviated after some delay. If known, the length of the delay may be indicated in a Retry-After header. If no Retry-After is given, the client SHOULD handle the response as it would for a 500 response.

Note: The existence of the 503 status code does not imply that a server must use it when becoming overloaded. Some servers may wish to simply refuse the connection.

errorGeneric.description: Object returned when an error occurs (4xx/5xx)

transactionId.description: Transaction's tracking identification generated by API.

errorCode.description:
Internal API error code. Ex.: API-3566. This code can be used by
consumer to map its error message.

link.description:
Object containing page link to errors detailed documentation on
API Portal.

rel.description:
To reference the API portal error page is used the “related”
semantics in this scenario.

error.detailedMessage: Required some parameters not found: 'customerContractId' or 'smartCardNumber'. It is mandatory to fill only one of the two fields informed.
For requests that uses 'customerContractId', it is necessary to enter the 'cityId' or 'operatorCode'. It is mandatory to fill only one of the two fields informed.
Format data field informed is no valid. Only numbers are valid. Please check the documentation out to know the correct way to fill in the fields.
Required parameters not found: 'addressableCode', 'startDate', 'endDate', or the boolean flag 'detailed'. It is mandatory to fill all of the fields informed.
The xquery string informed is out of standard. Please check the documentation out to know the correct way to fill in the fields.
The endDate field contains a date earlier than the startDate. Please enter an endDate later than the startDate.
